intro: Verbascum phlomoides var. album, commonly known as the white mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is part of the Scrophulariaceae family and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are thick and fuzzy, providing a habitat for various insects and small animals. The plant is also known for its medicinal uses, particularly in traditional herbal remedies.
